sen.j: 楊谷寺（ようこくじ）は京都府長岡京市にある西山浄土宗の寺院。
sen.e: Yokoku-ji Temple is a temple of Seizan Jodo sect, which is located in Nagaokakyo City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Yokoku-ji Temple, located in Nagaokakyo City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a temple of the Seizan Jodo sect.
Yokoku-ji Temple, located in Nagaokakyo City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a temple of the Seizan Jodo sect.

sen.j: 独鈷水（おこうずい）の寺として、また近年はアジサイの寺としても知られている。
sen.e: It is known as a temple of Okozui (Tokko water) and, recently, Japanese hydrangea.
It is known as a temple of Okozui (Tokko water) and, recently, Japanese hydrangea.
It is known as a temple of Okozui (Tokko water) and, recently, Japanese hydrangea.

sen.j: 通称柳谷観音（やなぎだにかんのん、楊はヤナギ）。
sen.e: It is commonly called Yanagidani Kannon ("Yo" in Yokoku-ji means "Yanagi" (a willow tree)).
It is commonly called Yanagidani Kannon ("Yo" in Yokoku-ji means "Yanagi" (a willow tree)).
It is commonly called Yanagidani Kannon ("Yo" in Yokoku-ji means "Yanagi" (a willow tree)).
Its fair (anniversary of Founder's death) is 17th of each month.
Its fair (anniversary of the founder's death) is celebrated on the 17th of each month.
Its fair (anniversary of the founder's death) is celebrated on the 17th of each month.

sen.j: 寺伝では清水寺の開祖延鎮が806年に開山。
sen.e: According to the temple legend, Enchin, the founder of Kiyomizudera Temple, founded this temple in 806.
According to the temple legend, Enchin, the founder of Kiyomizudera Temple, established this temple in 806.
According to the temple legend, Enchin, the founder of Kiyomizu-dera Temple, established this temple in 806.

sen.j: 延鎮が夢のお告げによりこの地に十一面千手千眼観世音菩薩像を発見し堂を建て安置したのが始まりとされる。
sen.e: It is said to have started when Enchin found a statue of Juichimen Senju Sengan Kannon Bosatsu based on an omen in a dream and built a hall to enshrine it in this place.
It is said to have started when Enchin found a statue of Juichimen Senju Sengan Kannon Bosatsu based on an omen in a dream and built a hall to enshrine it in this place.
It is said to have started when Enchin found a statue of Juichimen Senju Sengan Kannon Bosatsu based on an omen in a dream and built a hall to enshrine it in this place.

sen.j: その後延鎮が清水寺に帰った後に空海が度々、ここで修行をした。
sen.e: After Enchin returned to Kiyomizudera Temple, Kukai often performed trainings here.
After Enchin returned to Kiyomizudera Temple, Kukai often performed training here.
After Enchin returned to Kiyomizu-dera Temple, Kukai often performed training here.

sen.j: その際に猿が瞑れた目をここの湧き水で洗っていたのを見た空海が眼病に効く独鈷水として広めた。
sen.e: As Kukai one day saw a blind monkey washing its eyes with spring water welling up from this land, he spread this water as Okozui effective for eye troubles.
One day Kukai saw a blind monkey washing its eyes with spring water that welled up from this land, so he spread this water as Okozui, saying it was effective for eye problems.
One day Kukai saw a blind monkey washing its eyes with spring water that welled up from this land, so he spread this water as Okozui, saying it was effective for eye problems.

sen.j: 木造十一面千手観音立像（府指定重要文化財） － 毎月17,18日にご開帳
sen.e: The wooden statue of Juichimen Senju Sengan Kannon Bosatsu (an important cultural property designated by Kyoto Prefecture) - Gokaicho (unveiling a Buddhist image): 17th and 18th of each month
sen.cmt: 既出の「十一面千手千眼観世音菩薩像」と同じものだと判断して訳出致しました。
sen.e: The wooden statue of Juichimen Senju Sengan Kannon Bosatsu (an important cultural property designated by Kyoto Prefecture) - Gokaicho (unveiling a Buddhist image): the 17th and 18th of each month
The wooden statue of Juichimen Senju Sengan Kannon Bosatsu (an important cultural property designated by Kyoto Prefecture) - Gokaicho (unveiling a Buddhist image): the 17th and 18th of each month

sen.j: 阪急電鉄京都本線長岡天神駅よりタクシーで13分またはバスで奥海印寺下車後徒歩30分
sen.e: 13 minutes by taxi from Nagaokatenjin Station of the Hankyu Corporation Kyoto Line or 30 minutes walk from Okukaiinji bus stop
It is 13 minutes by taxi from Nagaokatenjin Station of the Hankyu Corporation Kyoto Line or a 30-minute walk from the Okukaiinji bus stop.
It is 13 minutes by taxi from Nagaokatenjin Station of the Hankyu Corporation Kyoto Line or a 30-minute walk from the Okukaiinji bus stop.

sen.j: 西日本旅客鉄道東海道本線（JR京都線）長岡京駅よりタクシーで20分またはバスで奥海印寺下車後徒歩30分
sen.e: 20 minutes by taxi from Nagaokakyo Station of the West Japan Railway Tokaido Main Line (JR Kyoto Line) or 30 minutes walk from Okukaiinji bus stop
It's 20 minutes by taxi from Nagaokakyo Station of the West Japan Railway Tokaido Main Line (JR Kyoto Line) or a 30-minute walk from the Okukaiinji bus stop.
It's 20 minutes by taxi from Nagaokakyo Station of the West Japan Railway Tokaido Main Line (JR Kyoto Line) or a 30-minute walk from the Okukaiinji bus stop.

sen.j: 17日の縁日（命日）のみ 阪急電鉄京都本線大山崎駅より楊谷寺門前まで臨時バスの便あり。
sen.e: Some extra buses are available from Oyamazaki Station of the Hankyu Corporation Kyoto Line only on the 17th of each month, on the day of fair (anniversary of Founder's death).
Some extra buses are available from Oyamazaki Station of the Hankyu Corporation Kyoto Line on the 17th of each month, on the day of the fair (commemorating the anniversary of the founder's death).
Some extra buses are available from Oyamazaki Station of the Hankyu Corporation Kyoto Line on the 17th of each month, on the day of the fair (commemorating the anniversary of the founder's death).
(For details, contact Yokoku-ji Temple)

sen.j: 車 京都府道・大阪府道79号伏見柳谷高槻線 (長岡京市側、島本町側ともに一部離合困難箇所があるので要注意) 駐車場完備
sen.e: By car: Kyoto and Osaka prefectural road No.79 Fushimi Yanagidani Takatsuki Route (Be careful that there is a place where merging and separating are difficult on both Nagaokakyo City side and Shimamoto-cho side.) Parking lot available

By car: Kyoto and Osaka Prefectural Road No. 79, Fushimi Yanagidani Takatsuki Route (caution is required when merging and separating on both the Nagaokakyo City side and Shimamoto-cho side); a parking lot is available.

By car: Kyoto and Osaka Prefectural Road No. 79, Fushimi Yanagidani Takatsuki Route (caution is required when merging and separating on both the Nagaokakyo City side and Shimamoto-cho side); a parking lot is available.
